comments.body:
Cut off by word limit again? That's just rude, anyway, in all seriousness this change could work well with my mineshaft overhaul for caves and cliffs idea, more so if so of the minecart variants were unique to the mineshafts to encourage exploration and for flavour.

Thanks for reading    (:

(the mineshaft proposal of mine is here if you haven't seen it: (Much Needed) General Mineshaft Overhaul – Minecraft Feedback )
Excellent feedback! I hope the devs see this.

That is a bad idea, to nerf such a powerful mob in the depths of the overworld just doesn't make sense. It's literally at the bottom or the world, what'd you expect, a cute buffed neutral glowsquid that does 1 heart. If you're scared of losing your stuff when mining in the deepest depths, PREPARE, always prepare for situations when playing minecraft or any other type of game. Besides the game needs more challenge and we already lost mountain challenges thanks to the glowsquid, so nerfing the warden will do more harm than good

From what I have seen so far, the warden is very slow to start attacking you. Of course, before it even begins to attack, it has to hear you, but when it does, it will move very slowly to your location, giving you plenty of time to get away. If you hit it however, it seems to enrage, and it will give off a roar. While it is roaring it stays still, giving you one last chance to get out of there. If you do not, it will run straight at you, and at this point, it is much more difficult to get away from . I'm only saying that, if you encounter a warden, it is not an instant death sentence. If you do not want to fight the warden, just get out of there before it enrages. It gives you plenty of time to react to its presence, or so it seems at this point. To be honest, we'd really need to see the warden in a snapshot first before we begin to talk about nerfing it.
The Warden is not even out yet... sometimes they nerf it before being released..

First off, it's not in the game yet, also it's the main purpose is for players to stealth towards a reward so just nerfing it would defeat the purpose because they could kill it easily. As well it's in the deep dark biome so people would know it would be lurking near.

The thing is that you wouldn't (or perhaps shouldn't) just happen to stumble across the Warden. The Deep Dark would only generate below Y=0 from our knowledge, and judging by the ore generation, I believe it is likely that the Deep Dark would generate exclusively and continuously below Y=-32 (or at least I hope so). If you mine that deep, you will probably have knowledge of what you're getting yourself into. It's not like you will just randomly find the Warden while mining or spelunking. Like others said, the Warden is meant to be a disaster that you stealth around, not a boss that you are encouraged to fight. If you tread carefully and use proper strategies to avoid it, it shouldn't detect you. Besides, I believe you would definitely be able to explore most of the underground without running into it, so if you don't want to stealth or take the risk, you can easily ignore the Deep Dark (along with all of the loot and features). Nerfing it would just destroy an entire gameplay feature, as would adding an item that allows to easily deal with it or avoid stealthing around it.
lel you can just climb up and shoot arrows at him why nerf him plus hes slow

I think that the warden is op especially science I figured out a way to spawn like 100000 of them, witch could absolutely wreak an smp, even one that's late game, u just use skulk strikers, skulk sensors, and a Redstone clock attached to a trapdoor, maby it could instate in daylight.

The warden is out now and insanely overpowerd don't get me wrong he needs to be strong but hiding in a 5 layer thick deepslate wall should not be able to be damaged through by the screech he has and maybe slightly less strength and or health the risk for reward isn't really worth it in my opinion consider the loot and the possibility of losing everything even in fully enchanted netherite if there was like netherite armor and better enchants maybe but for what it is worth not really unless it is early game but still really high risk I learned the hard way
You do know that the warden wasn’t meant to be killed, it’s a boss with no prize, it’s just stopping you from getting loot

I agree with many comments here that you should prepare while mining. However, it is very hard to know when you're under a mountain. If the mountain is very high, Sculk and the Warden may generate where you wouldn't expect. I've seen Sculk at levels as high as Y30. My solution to this is either making Sculk tend to generate less far up, or putting a hard cap (e.g. Y-16) on where it can be.

A few addendums to my last post since I feel like these are important to bring up, while also keeping in line with the sole idea of Lanterns actually being the topic and also because I'd run out of characters otherwise:

  • The lighting distance for Lanterns and Soul Lanterns is increased from 15/10 to 16/12. This is to further increase their utility and also make them be optimal in use for cave systems, especially deeper down you go in the world. However, utilizing more than one lantern won't double the lighting distance you get from them.
  • The Lantern and Soul Lantern items can now be equipped as Legging gear. When equipped as Leggings, they will be placed on the hip of the player's character, allowing them to be carried.
  • The Lantern and Soul Lantern items now sway back and forth every time the player walks forward and backward, but only if character sway is on.
  • Lanterns and Soul Lanterns can work underwater.

I'll also be talking about a new Lantern type elsewhere that I think should be added into the game, but this thread is only for functionality, not a new item.

I also had the same idea, as lighting up the new mega caves in 1.17 is going to be a huge chore. Many people play Minecraft for a short amount of time, and this would make progressing through the game a little easier. Also, when they introduced the Warden, they said they wanted to recreate the scary feeling of their first night in Minecraft. This would only add that. 

Also, while holding the Soul Lanterns, make it so Piglins are scared off. Instead of using them as legging gear, we should be allowed to hold the lanterns in our off-hands, making it easier to fight mobs in unexplored cave systems.

I don't know about this. It seems a little to modern having something that will play music in your hand. But I do think it would be cool to have music play as you walk. Perhaps they could add a jukebox in a minecart.
this would feel way to modern for Minecraft standers though. And it would feel way too modded.
guess your trying to get the same thing in the game! lol
i wanted pigstep to be the example!
I would enjoy a new flint and steel that has more durability.
It should be called Deepslate Gravel, Deep Gravel, Dark Gravel, or something like that. There should also possibly be variants for Granite, Diorite, and Andesite Gravel.
I knew there was one i was forgetting! yes, update dungeons too.
404994220052 when did they say that? Haven't heard anything about it.
This sounds cool, it would create new interesting way to hydrate farms
Nice idea! Don't take this as a promotion but I have a suggestion too, please consider checking it out!
Love the idea
The reason thats all there is in the spider section is because I ran out of space but that pretty much sums up what I want done with them.

I like the ideas for the zombie, but how about skeletons have a chance to use shields, rather then them using a melee item (which makes them less hard) The spiders at this depth could become "depth spiders" like cave spiders but stronger and the size of a normal spider.

I really like the idea of making the grimstone depths more difficult on average (the Warden helps, but it only spawns in the Deep Dark, so it's a relatively rare encounter).

However, I think the changes you suggested are a little too much to still fit the iconic mobs of Minecraft. The mechanics described would be a better fit to entirely new mobs (especially the soul fire, which I really like, just not for zombies.)

I'd personally go down the route of

A) Adding a zombie variant that has more natural armour and damage but the same AI, keep the skeletons as they are, adding a chance for cave spiders to spawn instead of spiders (maybe 1 in 10) and adding a new, rare type of creeper who's explosion treats grimstone like dirt.

Or

B) Keep all mobs the same, but add a new "common mob" for the region below y=0 that is a real danger to the players and is encountered often, unlike the Warden. Maybe some sort of ghoul that has a chance of inflicting weakness and faintness (an effect that is basically the reverse of resistance).

Overall, the concept you proposed definitely has potential. I hope Mojang sees it.
Yeah, they're too common. I think they should spawn in smaller clumps, along the line of 2-5 diamonds per vein instead of 4-8.
yea.... diamond needs to be tweaked a lot.

I played 21w07a, and got 10 diamonds on my first caving run. I did no mining, all of these were sitting in the caves. 

I would theoretically be able to make an enchanting table within the first few days in a world. The game shouldn't let me speed run through the first 3rd of the survival's content. Getting deep can be difficult but the vast increase in surface area the new caves have makes diamonds way easier to get. I don't think should spawn significantly more frequently then they do in 1.16.

 

I think iron & coal have a less extreme issue of over-abundance due the the cave changes and higher spawn rates and I think their rates should be nerfed slightly too.
Yes yes yes. I literally made the same post 5 minutes ago. However, I think you should just have to hold it in your hand, not put it on a stick.
While carrying a torch in your hand, the torch is reduced for a certain period of time.

397467747471 They can already cut off generation with a bottom slide feature they've already invented (they use a top slide feature to hide the bedrock ceiling in the Nether). These newer caves generate a lot like the Nether, so I see no issue with just utilizing bottom slide instead of just leaving it in the dust.
397467747471 If I remember right, I think they're planning on having a variable lava level like the water levels, but more limited to the lowest parts of the world.
Vote for them to see it!
Love it!

skeleton horseman (skeleton with skeleton horse) becomes stray horseman (stray with stray horse)
I would be happy if that happens.

stray horse drop leather_horse_armor & bones
When I chop an Azalea tree down I get wood and azalea saplings.  But the saplings never seem to grow after they have been planted...
Bundles are a very useful item, so I think it makes complete sense for them to be difficult to get. Plus, you can easily make a rabbit farm.
no because people would kill rabbits more and I want them to be a pet animal.

Another detail of the glow slime: if he is killed, it will release an item called "glow slime ball", using as an alternative to glow ink sac. But he also used to craft the "glow slime block", similar to the normal slime block but this emits light, the level of light is similar to the glowstone, the mechanics are similar to regular slime.

Already exists, glowberries!

 

 

 

Also rotten flesh but i don't think that counts
Glowberries only spawn in lush caves though.
maybe gloworms that when you eat only restores 1/2 hunger
perhaps a form of worm could work :)
the only food i can think of are fish and mushrooms. But mushrooms is probably not a good idea cause we dont want our kids trying those irl...
The boulders are made of mossy cobblestone, and because lichen is a moss that grows on rocks, it only makes sense that you'd find lichen on boulders.
True, It would make sense that a creature of fire would take damage by a passable cold block. I wonder if the opposite should be true, like blazes can destroy powdered snow as they die.
Also please let us decide which biome we spawn in
This reminds me of the custom world type that was removed in 1.13. I would love to see it reintroduced.

Fully agree with you. Even after Caves and Cliffs Update, I think that the world generation can be better. Bring back the "Custom World Type" and optimize it, giving us more freedom, would be an amazing solution.
Love this idea. Make sure you cannot see the characters on the sign glow in a light atmosphere.

I would like to suggest that the drops they give should be similar to magma cream but instead, it would be frost cream. The use would be to craft potions of frost resistance. these could be used in addition to leather armor to resist frost on the highest peaks/cold biomes or in large quantities of powdered snow. Also, the cold status effect should be possible in all cold biomes and at high elevations to some degree. thus making potions of frost resistance important. The most hostile conditions (possibly tall snowy mountains) should require users to have both leather armor and the frost resistance potion at the same time to get rid of the frost effect compleatly. Additionally, it would be interesting if you only have one it just slows the onset of the status effect giving you more time to get out of the situation.
Thank you for the comment, also, this is a very good idea [do try to ask others to vote for this] more comments would be nice...

as of we know right now, the mountains [cliffs] biome lacks mobs, despite powdered snow and goat, the cliffs biome lacks challenge and I'm not counting the climbing part...adding this mob to Minecraft would make the cliffs more challenging and unique...VOTE FROST CUBE...
Maybe they could be made out of 'Ice' then a blue slime
Maybe like the snow golem, they melt in warmer climates, but instead turn into slimes?

Minecraft mob 
a redstone golem the got frozen but came back as a frozen ice redstone golem

Please, no more cubes! Slimes spawn wherever they like and magma cubes pile on top of you while you wait for the portal to kick in. The idea of more cubes makes me want to cry.

If you just want to reskin an existing mob, give us brown bears on snow mountains or add mountain hares to the biome's spawn list.

Frost Cubes would spawn near ruined nether portals in the snow biome. These nether portals are slightly different because they lack lava, magma, or netherrack. Frost cubes would behave exactly like magma cubes. They drop frost cream which can be used to make a potion of freezing resistance.
forgot to mention, that with freeing at least 1 creature, you get the achievement 'thawing out history'
I wouldn't add actual mobs from history, but it would be cool if there was an ancient Minecraft mob

The mobs frozen inside could look more like older games, possibly 2D. They could simply be more prehistoric versions of current mobs, such as Neanderthal Villagers, or the Wooly Cow from Minecraft Earth.
There could be crustacean or bug like mobs that act like prehistoric silverfish
It would be cool if ice could be made into storage blocks for items like with sand and gravel in archaeology. While the item could be seen inside them, they may be more fragile
Also, it would be rad if Minecraft players shiw cold breath when in cold biomes. In hot biomes they could drip sweat particles
